errors.title: ‚öôÔ∏è  Configuration Syntax Error
errors.context: This error occurs when the YAML configuration file has invalid syntax.
errors.impact: Deployment will fail until the syntax is corrected.
errors.formattedMessage: YAML syntax error in amplify.yml: amplify.yml syntax error: invalid YAML indentation

originalError.title: Configuration Error
originalError.message: amplify.yml syntax error: invalid YAML indentation

immediate: Check YAML indentation (use 2 spaces, no tabs)
Validate YAML syntax using online validator
Look for missing colons or quotes in values
detailed: Open the configuration file in a text editor
Check for consistent indentation (2 spaces per level)
Ensure all string values with special characters are quoted
Validate the file structure matches the expected schema
Use a YAML linter or validator to identify specific issues
preventive: Use a code editor with YAML syntax highlighting
Set up pre-commit hooks to validate YAML files
Use configuration templates to avoid syntax errors

errors.title: üì¶ Node.js Not Found
errors.format: Node.js is not installed or not in PATH
errors.context: Node.js is required for frontend build and package management.
errors.impact: Frontend build will fail and npm commands will not work.
errors.formattedMessage: Node.js is not installed or not in PATH

detailed: Download Node.js LTS version from official website
Run the installer with administrator privileges
Add Node.js to system PATH if not done automatically
Verify npm is also installed: npm --version
Consider using Node Version Manager (nvm) for version management
preventive: Use Node Version Manager (nvm) for consistent environments
Document required Node.js version in README
Include Node.js version check in build scripts

errors.title: üî® Compilation Failed
errors.impact: Build artifacts cannot be created until compilation issues are resolved.
errors.formattedMessage: Compilation failed in backend: Compilation failed: missing import statement

immediate: Review error message for specific details
detailed: Analyze error context and related components
Consult documentation for the affected component
preventive: Use version control for configuration changes
